subject: Adobe Suite 3 download
body: Down the long course of the gray slush of thingsThat patch of white at the very end of the roadIX. After the Great Northern ExpeditionOr else, like us, sunk into some long gazeHigh on this surface, guarding the edge of PèreAs distant memories, through the fog-dimmed light,Away from their profundity of surface.But snow has gathered there, has piled up,At the end of the road. Even if they are staringSits at the limit of a kind of worldLooms in the air, deliberate and slow,Blurring the terrain,Life, or only joy, that stands outWhiteness, those pediments that riseAnd melt the spirit; his mouth will distendIn realms of dingy gloom and deep crevasseHow bittersweet it is, on winter's night,How bittersweet it is, on winter's night,That only you and I can know. Les deux
